newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo corn futures end mixed, after earlier losses.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo corn futures end mixed, after earlier losses.

text.p: Tokyo corn futures closed mixed on Tuesday after some contracts recovered from earlier price losses, traders said.
Prices ranged from 170 yen lower to 130 yen higher, with the benchmark March 1998 contract down 170 yen at 16,690 yen per tonne. The day's volume was 65,374 lots.
All contracts fell sharply at the opening, as CBOT new crop corn futures overnight ended lower on higher-than-expected USDA corn acreage estimates, traders said.
But stronger CBOT Project A overnight trading today triggered buying from local investors later, they said.
The spot May contract on the CBOT Project A trading system was trading at $3.13-1/2 per bushel at 0800 GMT, up from $3.10 at Monday's close.
Spot May CBOT soybean futures on the overnight trading system were at $8.67-3/4 per bushel, up from $8.55-3/4 at Monday's close.
